The old space-sims of yore were right up my alley.

Hey guys, I'm wondering if I should get Elite: Dangerous and whether it would be the right game for me.

Really, I'm not interested in combat. Heck, I hate it! I love games like KSP and Space Engine because of the immense scale, and I want to explore a universe as large as Elite: Dangerous with realism and graphical beauty. I want to have my own spacecraft and explore the galaxy with it.

It's a bit pricy, but if it's the game I've been looking for I'm sure I can spend the money.

Personally I'm waiting for a discount or similar. As an SP game where I can spend my own time, I might have got it. As it's Online only, I'm only paying to "rent" it, so only aiming for that price.

If it was fully featured (just a few more features missing from it so far), I'd again go for it right away. For now I'm waiting it out as I am Star Citizen.

I know enough of the game to tell you that while you can trade, explore and do other non-combat stuff, you WILL occasionally be dragged in a combat-situation.

It's virtually not possible to have 0% combat.

If you're okay with some, then Elite Dangerous might be the exploration game you seek.

I recommend watching some video's before committing to buying. No trailers but real gameplay.

This is obviously personal opinion, but although u are technically renting it I don't see frontier closing the servers any time soon, at least without a patch to remove the drm. The game was built with future compatibility in mind, and made to be compatible with extremely high resolutions.
